page.title: 19Development Of Moulton
page.content: Salt mining increased around Moulton in the mid 19th Century. Many people who worked in the salt industry moved to Moulton from surrounding areas. Between 1801 and 1891AD the population has increased by 1006. Because their workers had no where to live the salt union built 2 rows of terraced housing and called them Church and Regent Street. Since 1960AD many new houses have been built and 3 new housing estates. They were named Beechfield, Weaver Grange and Lodge Drive. This led to an increase in population of over 2000. The increases in population created more custom for the village shop and services. There are 10 shops and over 900 houses in Moulton.
